results.title: Basketball diaries
results.creator_credit: Island Pictures, Liz Heller and Scott Kalvert
results.brief_description: ‘The Basketball Diaries’ is a horrowing growing-up story based on the true-life exploits of poet and musician Jim Carroll. Jim begins as a high-school basketball star at a Catholic high school where he experiments with drugs and is physically abused by his teachers. When his best friend dies of leukemia, Jim’s life suddenly becomes much more than adolescent angst, with him making the dark descent into the hell of heroin addiction and hustling. Jim’s poetry is the only thing he has left when he is found, literally on the street, by a tough ex-junkie, who undertakes his rehabilitation. Cast include: Leonardo Di Caprio, Bruno Kirby, Juliette Lewis and Ernie Hudson.

results.title: Basketball clinic
results.creator_credit: Seven Network Limited (Australia), Dick Jones and Brendan McKenna
results.brief_description: This film shows a judicious selection of situations from games of basketball played in Melbourne, using stills, action replays, etc to provide excellent illustrations of playing areas, fouls, and shooting and rebounding skills. It is recommended for use with students who have basic proficiency in basketball.

results.title: Basket case
results.creator_credit: Analysis Films, Edgar Levins and Frank Henenlotter
results.brief_description: Hilarious, cult, low-budget, highly eccentric slasher horror flick from Frank Henenlotter is about two Siamese twins, reluctantly separated in adolescence by merciless doctors. Seeking revenge, the two (one a full bodied man, and the other a head in a basket) set up in a seedy New York hotel, where they encounter an array of fringe dwellers. Minimal and basic special effects do not detract from the gruesome fun of seeing a mutant, enraged head on the rampage. Followed by two sequels in the 1990s.

results.title: Basilisk
results.creator_credit: Wayne Stamp, Panos Couros and Lloyd Sharp
results.brief_description: ‘Basilisk’ is an interactive CD-Rom that operates as a conceptual journey into an ancient illustrated philosophical text and an imaginary bestiary. Through labryinthine visuals and language, ‘Basilisk’ charts a fiction of the genesis of the male as a queered perspective on subjectivity. As the artists state: “It derives its intensities from an alchemistry of mediaeval marvels and a bricolage of contemporary nomadic thought… Basilisk diagrams the multiple relations that converge upon a making of the male that is monstrous and virtual. As a queered perspective on subjectivity, it derives itself from a hybrid relation between the alchemistry of wonder and a wander in the fourfold thought of the subject in Felix Guattari’s philophical text ‘Chaosmosis’.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Stamp, Panos Couros and Lloyd Sharp

results.title: Basics of direct instruction
results.brief_description: Gives an overview of the Direct Instruction technique which was developed in the 1960’s to develop successful students with a positive approach and works on problem solving skills so students learn to learn. Skills are broken into sub-skills until mastered and integrated. Notes the goals, assumptions and characteristics of Direct Instruction programmes, provides a brief description of teaching techniques and how to prepare a Direct Instruction program.

results.title: Basic training and conditioning: weight training. No. 2
results.creator_credit: Ryan Films and Dr Frank Ryan
results.brief_description: Shows the role played by muscles in various athletic events and illustrates the different exercises necessary for muscle development. A brief examination of the fibres of the muscles is given explaining how they function and how muscles are strengthened; preliminary conditioning for a young athlete training for shot putting, showing him incorporating and practising a weight training program; and the muscles emphasised in discus throwing, the high jump, and the javelin, and the weight training associated with each.

results.title: Basic training and conditioning: weight training. No. 1
results.creator_credit: Ryan Films and Dr Frank Ryan
results.brief_description: Expresses the opinion that much of the athletic achievement in recent years has been due to weight training and indicates the events associated with weight training or weight lifting. The part played by the various muscles in these events are pointed out, and the training program for developing these muscles illustrated and described.

results.title: Basic stairbuilding
results.brief_description: Master carpenter Scott Schuttner will instruct you on how to build solid and attractive stairs by assembling two common staircases: a straight run stair and an L-shaped stair. You will also discover how a professional troubleshoots and corrects problems, how to calculate and mark the rise and run for any length stair, anchor posts and handrails and fasten treads and risers. During the action, the camera takes you where your eyes want to be.

results.title: Basic skills of women's basketball
results.brief_description: This films uses slow motion and still photography to demonstrate the necessary skills required for women’s basketball. Skills dealt with include passing, catching, dodging, foot work, goal shooting and intercepting. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic skills
results.creator_credit: Gerard Holdsworth Productions and Don Kelly
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Table Tennis”
Part 1 of a series of four films which show that table tennis is a very competitive sport played throughout the world by people of all ages. This film shows certain basic qualities essential for table tennis and the fundamental techniques.
